discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
When you click Enable, Tanzu Mission Control installs the data protection extension, the selected plug-ins, and Velero on your cluster. After it is installed, the data-protection extension is listed on the cluster detail page along with its status.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Tanzu-Mission-Control/services/tanzumc-using/GUID-5EF38D8D-2085-4924-B78B-D49C63064F31.html

questions.question_text: Which two are installed on the target cluster when VMware Tanzu Mission Control Data Protection is enabled? (Choose two.)
Which steps are required to create a vSphere Namespace?

choices.C: In the vSphere web client, select Workload Management, select Namespaces tab, and click Create Namespace
choices.B: Create the Namespace using the Tanzu CLI
choices.A: In the vSphere web client, select Supervisor, select Namespaces tab, and click Create Namespace
choices.D: In the vSphere web client, select Supervisor, select Workload, select Namespaces tab, and click Create Namespace

choices.B: Harbor, formerly known as Bitnami, is an image catalog used for downloading verified open source packages.
choices.C: Harbor is an open source registry that secures artifacts with policies and role-based access control, ensures images are scanned and free from vulnerabilities, and signs images as trusted.
choices.A: Harbor requires that all images are pulled from GitHub and is used for image validation and verification.
choices.D: Harbor is an image scanner used to verify that images are free from known vulnerabilities and patches as necessary.

questions.question_text: What is the function of Velero?

discussion.content: A. Backup and restore Kubernetes clusters

choices.C: Publish DNS records for applications to DNS servers
choices.D: Collect data and logs from different sources, unify them, and send them to multiple destinations

questions.question_text: Which command has a valid syntax for scaling VMware Tanzu Kubernetes Grid cluster using Tanzu CLI?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. it is the right answer

B. it is the right answer because the very same example is on: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Tanzu-Kubernetes-Grid/2.5/using-tkg/workload-clusters-scale.html
tanzu cluster scale MY-CLUSTER --controlplane-machine-count 5 --worker-machine-count 10

Selected Answer: B
tanzu cluster scale MY-CLUSTER --controlplane-machine-count 5 --worker-machine-count 10

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Tanzu-Kubernetes-Grid/2.2/using-tkg/workload-clusters-scale.html
